claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.

extracted_evidence.quote: Vaccine efficacy against antigenic ally matched culture confirmed CDC-ILI could not be determined reliably because 96% of the influenza isolates obtained from subjects in Study 1 were not antigenic ally matched to the strains represented in the vaccine.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote supports the claim because it shows that the influenza viruses isolated from vaccinated individuals were often not antigenically matched to the vaccine strains, which can be a result of mutations arising during vaccine production or circulation, potentially reducing vaccine effectiveness.
